snippet.title: 10,000 people set to flock to new Coast festival
snippet.content:
A MASSIVE, two-day festival of sports, live music, food trucks and drinks are coming to the Coast.
Event People director Scott Hollow said the Beach Carnivale music, sports and food festival was confirmed to head to Cotton Tree on October 21-22.
Amusement rides, a beer, cider and wine hall, live music and 15-20 food trucks, a mixture of local and external, will be the support acts to a weekend of fast-paced, fun, social sport.
Dodgeball, skateboarding, three-on-three basketball and half-court netball will all be played at the popular Coast suburb in what Mr Hollow hoped would become a family-friendly annual event.
He expected more than 10,000 people to attend the new festival.
"It's about being fun and family-friendly," he said.
He said the sporting events would be run by local sporting organisations who could share in the entry fee takings and hopefully boost their memberships in the process with the exposure, with his company taking care of the marketing.
"One hundred per cent (we hope to make it an annual event)," Mr Hollow said.
"The target market is families to come down."
Mr Hollow said the Sunshine Coast Council had been keen to get the event up here, and he said there was also scope for the Australian Beach Games, a more extensive beach sports festival, to also be established on the Coast.
The website is being finalised and registrations are set to open soon for the event, which is open to punters to form a team and get involved.
